15/*! \file */
16
17#include <config.h>
18
19#include <errno.h>
20
21#include <isc/condition.h>
22#include <isc/strerr.h>
23#include <isc/string.h>
24#include <isc/time.h>
25#include <isc/util.h>
26
27isc_result_t
28isc_condition_waituntil(isc_condition_t *c, isc_mutex_t *m, isc_time_t *t) {
29 int presult;
30 isc_result_t result;
31 struct timespec ts;
32 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
33
34 REQUIRE(c != NULL && m != NULL && t != NULL);
35
36 /*
37 * POSIX defines a timespec's tv_sec as time_t.
38 */
39 result = isc_time_secondsastimet(t, &ts.tv_sec);
40
41 /*
42 * If we have a range error ts.tv_sec is most probably a signed
43 * 32 bit value. Set ts.tv_sec to INT_MAX. This is a kludge.
44 */
45 if (result == ISC_R_RANGE)
46 ts.tv_sec = INT_MAX;
47 else if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
48 return (result);
49
50 /*!
51 * POSIX defines a timespec's tv_nsec as long. isc_time_nanoseconds
52 * ensures its return value is < 1 billion, which will fit in a long.
53 */
54 ts.tv_nsec = (long)isc_time_nanoseconds(t);
55
56 do {
57#if ISC_MUTEX_PROFILE
58 presult = pthread_cond_timedwait(c, &m->mutex, &ts);
59#else
60 presult = pthread_cond_timedwait(c, m, &ts);
61#endif
62 if (presult == 0)
63 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
64 if (presult == ETIMEDOUT)
65 return (ISC_R_TIMEDOUT);
66 } while (presult == EINTR);
67
68 strerror_r(presult, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
69 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
70 "pthread_cond_timedwait() returned %s",
71 strbuf);
72 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
73}
74
